column1: Las Breñas is a city in Chaco Province
column2: Argentina. It is the head town of the Nueve de Julio Department.

column1: The economy of Las Breñas is centrad around agriculture and farming. It is home to an Instituto Nacional de Tecnología Agropecuaria facility.
The climate of Las Breñas is classified as subtropical with dry winters
column2: which under the Köppen climate classification would be classified as a humid subtropical climate (Cwa). The yearly average maximum temperature is 28.1 °C (82.6 °F) while the yearly average minimum temperature is 14.9 °C (58.8 °F) with a yearly mean of 21.1 °C (70.0 °F). Summers are characterized by very high temperatures; the highest temperature recorded was 44.8 °C (112.6 °F) on December 10
column3: 1970. In contrast winters are mild with cool nights and temperatures can be very low with the lowest temperature recorded being −7.5 °C (18.5 °F) on July 20
column4: 1957. With the average first and last dates of frost being May 31 and September 3 respectively
column5: Las Breñas has a frost free period of 256 days although frosts as early as April 15 and as late as October 6 has occurred.The average annual precipitation is 946.0 millimetres (37 in) with most of the precipitation occurring during the warmer months. From May to September
column8: with these 5 months only registering 14% of the total annual precipitation. However
column9: annual precipitation from year to year is highly variable
